newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS-factors to watch - Aug 26.
newsitem.headline: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS-factors to watch - Aug 26.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors affecting Indian stock markets on Monday morning.
** Fund managers will take fresh look at blue-chip shares this week, rekindling hopes of market recovery after month-long slide, analysts say
** The delayed budget for fiscal 1996/97 (April-March) will be on the agenda as parliament resumes on Monday after summer break
Market analysts expect Finance Minister P. Chidambaram to make changes to a controversial minimum tax proposal on companies, before the budget is passed next month
** Annual inflation as measured by the wholesale price index rises 0.37 percentage points to 5.41 percent in the week ended August 10
** Three telecommunication companies, BPL Cellular, Bharati Televenture and Hutchison Max, plan raise $200 million each through an issue of American Depositary Receipts, the Economic Times reports
** The spot dollar/rupee opened steady at 35.71/73 per dollar and seen quiet, dealers say

** In the week to Friday, the 30-share Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) index rebounded from a 101 point plunge on Monday to close 48.65 points, or 1.4 percent, higher at 3,431.40 helped by domestic institutional buying
** On Friday, the 30-share Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) index rose 40.20 points, or 1.19 percent, to 3,429.00
** The 100-share National index firmed 13.09 points, or 0.84 percent, to 1,563.29
** The 50-stock National Stock Exchange index ended 11.0 points higher at 1,013
** The Delhi share index fell 3.71 points to 792.03
** The Calcutta index eased 3.37 points to 446.99
** The Madras index rose 3.0 points to 3,581.88
** The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index rose 0.55 points, or 0.76 percent, to 73.39 with the premium over the local market at 10.87 compared with Thursday's 12.09 percent
